intro: Excremis coarctata f. alba, commonly known as the white-flowered narrowleaf mallow, is a botanical variant characterized by its pale or white flowers. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes plants such as hibiscus and cotton. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, five-petaled blooms. It is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in temperate regions. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its native habitat, with a focus on efficient water use and light capture.
